intro: Anchusa longifolia, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces clusters of striking blue to violet tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Anchusa longifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
